ผู้ก่อตั้ง Cardano Charles Hoskinson กล่าวว่าเขาสูญเสียมากกว่า 3 พันล้านดอลลาร์ใน crypto แต่ปฏิเสธที่จะถอนเงิน

Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson says he has lost over $3B in crypto but refuses to cash out

5h ago//Vivian Nguyen
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

ชาร์ลส์ ฮอสคินสัน ผู้ก่อตั้ง Cardano เปิดเผยว่าเขาสูญเสียมากกว่า 3 พันล้านดอลลาร์ในคริปโต แต่ยังคงมุ่งมั่นที่จะสร้างนวัตกรรมบล็อกเชนโดยไม่คำนึงถึงสภาวะตลาด ในระหว่างการถ่ายทอดสด ฮอสคินสันกล่าวว่าเขาสามารถถอนเงินออกมาได้ง่ายๆ แต่เลือกที่จะไม่ทำ โดยเน้นย้ำว่าแรงจูงใจของเขาไม่ใช่การหวังผลประโยชน์ทางการเงินส่วนตัว เขายังคงรักษาความซื่อสัตย์โดยการหลีกเลี่ยงโอกาสที่น่าสงสัยและข้ออ้างที่ส่งผลกระทบต่อผู้อื่นในอุตสาหกรรม

EN

Charles Hoskinson, founder of Cardano, revealed he has lost over $3 billion in cryptocurrency but remains committed to blockchain innovation regardless of market conditions. During a livestream, Hoskinson stated he could easily cash out but chooses not to, emphasizing his motivation isn't personal financial gain. He has maintained integrity by avoiding questionable opportunities and scandals that have affected others in the industry, while encouraging the crypto community to endure market downturns and focus on collaboration and development.

Key Points

  • Charles Hoskinson has lost over $3 billion in crypto but refuses to cash out
  • He emphasizes his motivation isn't personal financial gain but blockchain innovation
  • Hoskinson encourages the crypto community to endure market downturns and focus on collaboration
  • He expresses optimism about Cardano's future projects like Hydra, Leios, and Midnight
  • Hoskinson co-founded Ethereum before launching Cardano in 2017

Article

Hoskinson maintains a focus on blockchain innovation despite large personal financial losses. Charles Hoskinson has lost over $3 billion in crypto but has chosen to stay committed, regardless of recent market losses, the founder of Cardano said during a Thursday livestream. “It’s easy for you to say, Charles, you’re rich. You can ride it out. I’ve lost more money than anyone listening to this, over $3 billion now,” Hoskinson said . “It’d have been real easy to cash out. Just walk away. And do you think I honestly care if I lose it all? Do you think I’m doing this for money? You’re pretty mistaken if you do.” Hoskinson emphasized that he is not motivated by personal gains and has avoided major scandals like the FTX fallout or the Epstein files by consistently turning down questionable opportunities and prioritizing integrity over access or influence. He previously criticized some industry leaders for accepting the flawed CLARITY Act in exchange for power, wealth, and elite status. Commenting on market conditions, Hoskinson encouraged the crypto community to endure the “red days” and focus on collaboration and continued development. “It’ll get worse. It’ll get redder. It is what it is. But at the end of the day, are you having fun? Find a way to. And know that each and every one of you in the cryptocurrency space, you’re doing something that matters. You’re doing something that has the potential to change the world,” he said. On Cardano, Hoskinson expressed optimism about the project’s infrastructure, governance, and future commercialization despite the downturn, with projects like Hydra, Leios, and Midnight showing development progress. Hoskinson co-founded Ethereum before leaving the project in 2014. He launched Cardano in 2017 through IOG with a focus on scientific research and sustainable blockchain design. In his remarks last night, Hoskinson also praised Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin and Solana co-founder Anatoly Yakovenko as allies in advancing crypto adoption.
